Reference

Available data

Data released with the package.

example_input

Example tibbles with input data in the format for (R)CONGAS+

example_object

Example object from (R)CONGAS+

campbell_bcpdx

(R)CONGAS+ object for the breast cancer patient-derived xenograft, first used in the original CONGAS paper. The original paper describing this data is Campbell, K.R., Steif, A., Laks, E. et al. clonealign: statistical integration of independent single-cell RNA and DNA sequencing data from human cancers. Genome Biol 20, 54 (2019). https://doi.org/10.1186/s13059-019-1645-z

Main functions

Functions to create and fit a dataset.

init()

Create a dataset.

auto_config_run()

Title

auto_normalisation_factor()

Compute empirical normalisation factors (library size)

fit_congas()

Fit a list of CONGAS model

Getters

Functions to extract information from a model.

get_input()

Extract input data.

get_fit()

Extract fit data.

stat()

Compute the statistics of a dataset.

Filtering

Functions to pre-process inputs and post-process models.

filter_known_genes()

Filter genes from an RNA tibble.

filter_outliers()

Filter per-segment outliers by quantiles.

filter_missing_data()

Filter per-segment outliers by quantiles.

Plotting functions

Functions to plot data and fits.

plot_data()

Plot data.

plot_fit()

Plot fits.

S3 functions

The rcongasplus S3 object functions.

print(<rcongasplus>)

Print for an object of class 'rcongasplus'.

plot(<rcongasplus>)

Plot for an object of class 'rcongasplus'.

Contents
